questions.question: What are the essential components of a Non-Deterministic Pushdown Automaton (NPDA) used in the conversion from Context-Free Grammar (CFG)?

answers.a: Input alphabet, stack alphabet, transition function, initial state, final state
answers.b: Input alphabet, tape alphabet, transition function, initial state, final state
answers.c: Input alphabet, stack alphabet, transition function, start variable, acceptance state
answers.d: Input alphabet, stack alphabet, transition function, start state, end state

questions.question: During the conversion from CFG to NPDA, what happens to the rules of the CFG?

answers.b: They are converted into states of the NPDA.
answers.c: They are transformed into transitions of the NPDA.
answers.d: They are applied directly to the input string.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the computational power of a Non-Deterministic Pushdown Automaton (NPDA) in relation to a Context-Free Grammar (CFG)?

answers.a: NPDA can recognize more languages than CFG.
answers.b: CFG can recognize more languages than NPDA.
answers.c: NPDA and CFG have equivalent computational power.
answers.d: NPDA and CFG have no relationship in terms of computational power.
